instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that has had its audio jack replaced elsewhere. Showing no audio devices in OSX (no chime either)
I have replaced the codec (<CHIP>U6201</CHIP>) twice, and still pin 4 of J6600 (jack) is O/L instead of 780 ohms (same with both codec's) 

Ive followed the line and found no bad traces (but have not checked the pad under the codec, but the BGA site looks clean without damage). 

Im not sure i want to lift the codec and have to re-ball again. But something is wrong. I am also worried because it shows no audio devices in system report.
Anyone got any ideas?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio
threads.message: Oh yeah, i forgot to say, All the power lines to the Audio codec are fine!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio
threads.message:
Codec should appear in system report, even if bad audio jack...
However, check all small coils L660x.
Also check for other knock off components, reball chip if you are not sure about solders.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio
threads.message:
Ive checked all small coils.
The jack is not bad, The codec has been replaced twice and im pretty certain of the soldering. 
Ive checked against other boards for knocked of components, i did find a bad 5V trace to the amplifiers and repaired that, however that will not fix the codec not being recognised in OSX.

Does anyone know how OSX communicates with the Codec? I think its through the HDA lines?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio
threads.message:
Yes, HDA_ lines, but audio codec should be in conditions to talk with PCH.
Check frist high level at <SIGNAL>HDA_RST_L</SIGNAL> and <RESISTOR>R6331</RESISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No Audio
threads.message: Fixed, seems i messed up the codec twice. Wasnt soldering very well that day.
